intro: Ouratea lucens var. podogyna, commonly known as the Brazilian beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple berries that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are small, white, and clustered in inflorescences, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
